author: jeffp
msg: Fixed Exception problem due to change in the Turbine MessageResources.java
Totally reengineered the Exception signatures. Did away with
ICalendarParseException. Replaced it with the more generic ICalendarException.
Previous Exception signatures varied greatly. When doing validation on input
to various parameters we were throwing three different exceptions,
In an attempt to present a more uniform API all exceptions we throw were changed
to ICalendarException. We decided to stay away from actually throwing
IllegalArgumentExceptions because it is deceiving to the API user. This
is because IllegalArgumentExceptions DO NOT have to be put in the throws
clause meaning that the compiler wont catch the fact an Exception can occur.
This could cause an API user to not wrap an iCalendar method that actually

author: burton
msg: init of JetspeedException which is a Prototype for all other Exceptions.  Applications could theoretically only catch JetspeedException and handle it
